text: I walk three miles a day on an asphalt bike path.  I have always worn New Balance shoes, but my feet were always burning when I neared the end of my walk.  I decided that I needed more cushioning and decided to try these ASICS because of the gel cushioning.  My feet are loving these ASICS.  I have had them for about 1 month and they are the best shoes I have ever worn.
title: Happy Feet

text: I used the Gel Nimbus 15s to train for a marathon over the summer.  A month from race day, they were getting worn down, so I bought the 16s to replace them.Compared to the 15, the Gel Nimbus 16 is less cushy, and has a touch more support.  Definitely still a neutral shoe.  Overall I think it's a bit more comfortable to run in, the old shoes could get kind of ponderous and squishy.  I would say it's like taking the soft touring tires off a Buick and putting tires with firmer sidewalls on.  Same basic ride, but the car feels more planted with more control.I did a ten miler right out of the gate in these shoes, and my knees, legs, and feet felt great after.  If you liked the 15s, I suspect you'd like these.  I wouldn't suggest them to people who buy expensive running shoes to just walk around in, but I would think most runners who liked the old shoes would love these.
title: Asics hits another home run.

text: High arches or supination (under-pronation)? These are probably the best running shoes you will find. ASIC's Gel Nimbus and Gel Cumulus are so great, nobody else seems to even try and compete. I'm 44 years old, run 3 miles/day and have supination issues. Have been using Gel Cumulus with no troubles, Gel Nimbus seem to be even cushier. Asics seems to be more concerned about runners with "odd" feet than other manufacturers, highly recommend both the gel Cumulus and Gel Nimbus.
title: These are probably the best running shoes you will find

text: I really like these shoes. I usually am a Nike fan boy but decided to give these a try and let me tell you: Wow! I loved them! They are to this date my best running shoe I have worn. I already put in over 40 miles of runs on them!
title: Love at first Run!

text: I'm using a combination of these new shoes for walking (taking a break from running for the recommended time), a shiatsu foot massager during my inactive time, and splints at night. Just in two days and nights I've gone from being on the verge of yelping from the pain and doing a stiff shufflewalk with my untreated plantar fascitis in the morning to waking with only some very mild soreness that doesn't affect my feets' flexibility at all. I looked up a lot of shoes that were recommended for plantar fascitis, and I chose these shoes because of the high user ratings and it was one of the few available for my big feet (14 wide). They fit greatFoot massager: http://smile.amazon.com/Homedics-FMS-270H-Kneading-Shiatsu-Massager/dp/B00DPMDWAA/ref=dp_ob_title_hpcMy night splints: https://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B006L8MON6/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1
title: Part of the combo that's helping greatly with my plantar fascitis

text: Waited 4yrs and on my birthday to buy new Asics! As you can see in the pic that my ones from 2011 footlocker have seen a lot of action! If you notice the place where my toes come up have worn through and the heels are heavily torn apart from taking them on/off and running. I ordered the 11.5 2E (Double Wide). When I received them, they came in a bag which obviously did not protect the box very well. Despite this fact the shoes were in 100% intact. As soon as I put my foot in these puppies it felt like I stuck my feet in shoe lined with pillows!!! These are almost worthy of wearing as an all day shoe! I will soon road test these shoes and update y'all!
title: Step in a shoe made of clouds!

text: I bought these in Feb' 15 to replace another pair of brand new Asics I had bought specifically to wear to work where I stand on concrete for several hours at a time. The pair I replaced about killed my feet and lower legs as the soles were not cushioned enough. Anyway, I had purchased a pair of the Gel Nimbus 13 shoes a few years ago which were great for standing on concrete, and for distance running for that matter, so after the failure with "the other pair of Asics", I searched Amazon for the Gel Nimbus 13's and came up with these Gel Nimbus 16's. These have been GREAT! I have a lot less discomfort in my feet and lower legs with prolonged standing on concrete at work. While one can't overlook the benefits of frequent calf muscle and Achilles tendon stretching to keep the feet comfortable, these shoes are very comfortable!
title: Very Comfortable for all Day Wear!!

text: This review actually starts with my 4 year experience using the Nimbus 11 as my secondary running shoe. I bought those in my oft-selected 13-D size. (I'm over 6'2". 225 lbs.) Although listed as neutral shoes, they felt a lot like stability shoes with good support and decent cushioning. (Not up to something like New Balance 993, but real good for the 50% off deal that I got for them at a mall store.)  In this size, they felt a skosh snug, but not uncomfortably so.Fast forward 4 years later: On a whim, I try on a pair of Nimbus 16's in 13-2E- the wider size definitely fit better. For people blind buying this, I'd suggest ordering the next size wider as that worked out better for me. Anyway, store was charging full sticker price, I check Amazon to see a 13-2E available (in the same White/Royal Blue combo as my Nimbus 11) at ~ 30% less price.These have the same likes as my Nimbus 11 (still have those, still holding up). Shoes were delivered ahead of schedule, I would gladly order another pair through Amazon.PS- For some reason, heading is showing that I bought a size 7D. I'll positively state here that I bought a 13-2E size.I'm barely past the break in period, but so far these have been a better fit than my original N11.
title: Next Wider Size Fit Better

text: Great neutral support Cushing road training shoe.  I have been running in NB shoes for the last decade as they always fit my foot the best.  Have been looking at the Nimbus for a while and decided to give them a try this year.  LOVE the Shoe!!!  Great fit, good seem like a well made shoe.  Its only been a few weeks, so I will need to see how they hold up.  If they do hold up, this will be my go to shoe in the future.Sizing:The fit is spot on for the listed size.  I wear a 10.5 D shoe and ordered both the 10.5 and 11 D size to try out.  The 10.5 fit well and would be the right size for walking and general use.  My toe had about 1/4 inch of room before hitting the end of the toe box.  Moving up to the 11 and it gave me a thumbs width worth of room between my toe and the end of the shoe.So if you like a minimal gap at the end of your shoe, get the size of your daily work shoe.  If you need a bit more room, I would go up a 1/2 size.Shoe is very neutral feeling. Going a 1/2 up though required the use of the lock lacing holes of the shoe to lock my foot in.  The 1/2 size is a bit more "floaty" in the foot feel compared to the 10.5 (my normal shoe size) but after the laces are tightened up, the fit and feel during a run is great.  Good response with a very cushioned feel.Best road training shoe I have owned.
title: Great cushing and neutral support - add 1/2 size up if you want a finger width space at end of shoe

text: These shoes are the best all around shoes I've ever had for walking all day and running with regards to comfort and quality.  I just recently started buying more expensive shoes like these and I find that the benefits of a good shoe outweigh the cost.  I also wear Mizuno Waverider shoes and Hoka Roku shoes.  The Mizunos are lighter and better looking and the Hokas have a great deal more absorption but these Asics do everything very well.  I highly recommend these shoes to any neutral runner or walker.
title: Wonderful all around shoe

text: The shoe fits and feels great, as have the prior few versions.BUT, it seems like this version of the shoe wears out much faster.  I went through a few pair much quicker than I have other versions.
title: Seems to wear out much faster than earlier versions

text: very good shoesi feel comfortable with it
title: nice shoes

text: Last year I had an injury and the doctor determined I also have bad knee bone bruises. Running in my old Adidas shoes was painful after a few minutes, so I looked for soft-sole shoes to reduce the impact on my knees and I stumbled on these Asics. The change was pretty dramatic. A day later I could run three times as much without pain. I even play basketball in these now. They're not too soft if you just press down on the sole with your hand to test it. You really have to wear them and run in them to see how well they absorb the shock. Unlike other shoes, these get softer the harder you step on them. A year later, I am very satisfied with them and would recommend without a doubt. They're still holding together very well (and they get stepped on all the time during basketball).
title: These shoes are awesome

text: Love Asics. Love the cushioning. I have peripheral neuropathy and these are best "walking tennies" I've found so far. Hard to find shoes (of any style) that work well with the alternating nerve sensations and numbness in my feet. These are very helpful. Along with a good lacing pattern. Mine are 10.5D and not sure if wider would be better. "D" is not pinching in the toe box on a marginally wide foot. Am very satisfied with this purchase and Amazon overall. Hope this helps someone.
title: Hope this assists someone...

text: Recently I've gotten back into shape and I wanted to get back into running after many, many years. I bought these shoes based on the positive Amazon rating and on recommendations from friends. I was a bit wary about buying them sight unseen over the internet, especially given that they are by no means cheap, but decided I could return if needed.Wow, these shoes are fantastic! I put them on and immediately ran a 5k. The difference between these and my old shoes (which were, admittedly, probably 10 years old) was like night and day. These fit and cushion so well that my feet barely felt tired after the 5k. I've never had a pair of shoes that I could just put on and immediately start using like that before. I've now been running 5k's 2-3 times per week for the month since I got them, and feel the price was well worth them helping me get back into it again.
title: Fantastic shoes

text: I replaced the insoles untried with first rate arch support full insoles. I purchased this make and model of shoe because it is recommended for those who tend to develop planters facitius (however that is correctly spelled). They are lightweight and appear to reduce the sense of impact while walkinfg. I do not run. Because I have only worn these shoes for six weeks or so, I do not know how well they will wear. Therefore, I withheld the fifth star.16 months later: barring winter months, i.e., 12 months of daily wear, these shoes have proved to be very comfortable. The tops are wearing out now. A first rate value for the money (about 100 U.S. dollars for the whitish color, which simply maintaining cleanliness leaves them with a dingy appearance-not a particular concern of mine. With these shoes and proper exercise, my planters fasciitis has not reaccured.
title: I purchased this make and model of shoe because it is recommended for those who tend to develop planters facitius (however ...

text: I've been wearing Asics for 25+ years since high school track days. I've tried other brands but always come back to Asics. These are the top-of-the-line Nimbus and I guess what makes them top is they have the most cushion, which is what I wanted. I use these for training and racing and usually put about 30~40 miles of running in per week training and racing half and full Ironman (13.1~26.2 miles). I have several pairs of Nimbus shoes that I rotate and these are one of them. They are extremely comfortable and "cushiony" and good for long runs. Since they are very expensive, I generally just buy 1 or 2 models back and don't worry about the color, just get the cheapest in my size, that will save you a few bucks. I have also used the "Kayano" model but feel the Nimbus have more cushion and feel better than the Kayano's (for me).
title: They are extremely comfortable and "cushiony" and good for long runs

text: Great shoe. Both this and the Cumulus are the most comfortable shoes I've ever worn. They're made with good material and fit perfectly for my feet. As an almost 200 pound guy who runs about 20 miles a week, these shoes do it for me.I'm mostly writing to say that I wear a size 11.5 in most shoes but had to get a 12 with this. I also had to get 4E instead of my normal 2E. I usually get Asics' Cumulus, and with the Cumulus 15, I wore a 11.5.Update: I ran about 350 miles in these over the course of a year, and they held up as well as you can expect. I was a little worried about the soft rubber on the bottoms, but they didn't seem to wear out any faster than other shoes.
title: Ran a little small for me, but otherwise great!

text: This is my second pair of ASiCS Gel-Nimbus. I do not think I will buy another type of shoe again. I am unique and have an extremely high arch, which causes my feet to roll to the outside. Almost all running shoes are made with the flat footed in mind and have cushion to roll your feet to the outside. Therefore, almost all running shoes make my foot roll extremely to the outside, which causes me to have severe foot, shin, and knee pain.I love this shoe because it was made with the rare people like me in mind. I know the company probably sells less of these shoes because there are less people with issues like mine, but they do not raise the price. I wear these shoes from the time I get up to the time I lay down. No special inserts required.
title: Fixes My Foot Shin and Knee Pain

text: Beautiful shoes. I wear Asics daily and have bought the $50 ones in the past. Those shoes are discontinued so I chose these for the colors and hoped that the gel would be cushioning. I have just received these shoes today and have been wearing them around the house to break in. The length of the shoe is true to size but the shoe is very tight. I really loosened the laces and it feels somewhat better. although the size that I ordered is the identical size to the previous 3 pairs of Asics that I absolutely wore out, I suspect that either these shoes are a little narrow or they just need to be broken in more. The padding on the bottom may need time to mold better to my foot or compress. Maybe that will give me more room but right now they are too tight particularly on the top of my feet. If I had it over I'd buy a slightly wider size but I'm optimistic that these will break in. Recommend
title: Beautiful Shoes, maybe a tad more narrow than expected

text: Love my Asics Men's Gel Nimbus shoes.  I wear orthotics with a good arch support from Playmakers as I need them for Plantar Fascitis.  The gel provides lots of cushioning and it is helping my foot heal after pain in my heel.  I needed to buy two new pairs of Asics as I wore my previous Asics Gel 15 Nimbus shoes out after wearing them almost 1 1/2 years.  It's like stepping out on clouds now,  love the cushioning!  I buy men's shoes because they have a wider shoe box.  Women's ASICS are too narrow and uncomfortable in the shoe box especially if you need orthotics.
title: Love my Asics Men's Gel Nimbus shoes

text: At 47, I don't mess around with my running shoes. I want the padding to save my knees and joints.  I used to have some real issues with foot and knee pain before I started getting good shoes. These are among the best. You can feel the padding right away when you put them on.  I have not experienced a shoe with more cushion in all the write places. I run 2x a week, 4 miles at a time. All year long.  Good quality.  I expect them to last a year before I replace them.  Note: You should change your shoes according to the miles and use you get out of them.  There are recommendations on the Internet. I should be changing mine more frequently, but I find these do the job for a year and I don't suffer for it.
title: Great shoe for running that protects your feet and knees

text: There Asics, a little expensive, but you get what you pay for. I struggled for years trying to find a pair of shoes that suited me. I always wanted to try Asics, but wouldn't pay the price. My wife talked me into it a few years ago, and I have been hooked ever since. I am 42 years old and a little on the heavy side, so I am by no means a runner, but I am pretty active and I try to walk daily. I am so glad my wife talked me into spending a little more money, like she told me, you buy all of these other brands and pay almost as much for them, and are never completely satisfied. I fell in love with my first pair and soon found out that in the long run Asics will actually save you money, because they last longer than the other brands. This is my 5th pair, and I will never wear anything but Asics.
title: Five Stars

text: This is by far the best pair of running shoes I have ever owned. I am not the type of runner who is serious enough about it to go to a proper running shoe store. I underpronate a little and the shoes help to correct that. They also have great cushioning and rebound. I can definitely tell a difference between these and lesser quality shoes.
title: This is by far the best pair of running shoes I have ever owned

text: I had purchased several pairs of these as gifts for others and I thought I would try them out for myself this time. Although they cost a little more than I am used to shelling out for my runners (I change them every 4 months) they seem to be worth it!  I have had them for less than a week and I have already run 25 km in them. They don't pinch, torque and have ample cushioning for my stride.  I see now, why others would ask for these as their birthday and/or Christmas gifts!I usually find that women's runners are just not as comfortable as men's running shoes and that a ladies 9 or a men's 8.5 fit perfectly and allow for foot swelling in the intense Texas heat. I have always been an Adidas fan (which is about 30 years), but this shoe is making a very strong case for defection!
title: A whole new running experience.

text: The shoe is very comfortable.  I wear them primarily as a casual shoe, as opposed to using them for running.  They fit great right out of the box and I have used them almost daily. I have walked around Philly on weekend afternoons and had no issues with any type of discomfort.  I really like them and they suit my purposes very well.I didn't comment on the width of the shoe because my width is below medium. I am a size 14 and its almost impossible to find a "narrow".  That being said, this shoe fit my width almost perfectly, which means if you are a medium it may (but does not guarantee) run a bit small as far as width.  Also, I didn't comment on the arch support because I deal with plantar fasciitis and I swap the inserts out for orthotics.
title: Very Comfortable

text: ASICS makes an excellent quality shoe and they have models that are good for supination, but they run tight, especially the toe box. I normally wear an 11 or 11.5 D in a regular shoe but it this case I had to go to a 12.5 4E to make room for my little toe.. The result is a shoe that is comfortable and perhaps a bit too big in the shoe box, but it works well for walking and hiking. I haven't run in them yet.The Amazon price was excellent, much better than the price in local stores, which often don't carry a wide range of models or extra wide shoes). I still wonder whether it would have been better to go to a store that specializes in running and walking shoes to get the best fitting shoes.  So far I am very happy with them.
title: Excellent shoe but try them on for size before purchasing.

text: I have a number of Asics and New Balance shoes, but this is the first Nimbus I've ever tried (been a fan of the Cumulus from Asics). This is like walking on cloud so far (only had them for a few days, but I've been wearing them all day and done some running). While I generally am told I should go with a motion control type shoe I just can't say no to cushion so definitely happy. This and the NB 1260v5 I bought recently are easily my favorite shoes, but right now I'd say the Nimbus comfort tops it.
title: The best cushion by far...

text: I'm not a runner, knees forbid that now, so walking is what I do. After reading many articles determining what type of shoe I needed I compared a number of shoes suggested as the best in that category. Trying to balance cost versus performance I opted for these, so far have no reason to doubt my judgement. They fit well and feel good when walking.
title: Really Nice Shoes For The Money!

text: I've only used it at the gym a few times, so that's a bit of a caveat there.Having said that, this is by far the cushiest trainers I've ever had. The last time I wore a pair of Asics was nearly 30 years ago, and I can see that they've made progress.I have (very) flat feet and I believe I have a neutral gait (as in no over-pronation or supination). This shoe is another in a line of shoes I've been trying to find to fit me. My previous pair of trainers was the Brooks Beast. A control shoe that made me feel quite uncomfortable, and aggravated my peroneal tendonitis.This Nimbus seems to not do that ... though, again, I've only used it all of 3 times. But am optimistic.I bought a US12.5 2E. Fits well.
title: Very cushy.

text: This is my wife's account, I'm a male writing about the Asics Nimbus 16 that I just received. I run about an average of 5-10 miles per week. Concrete running, mostly dry.These shoes are AMAZING!! I had the Numbus 13 and I just wore them out. I bought a pair of Brooks Ravenna 5 and returned them the very next morning. I tried Brooks because I have a wide foot and I heard the the toe box on Brooks is a bit more roomy. The Brooks felt thin and left me uninspired. I say this because every time I wear my Asics, I want to go and run die to the comfort and fit.I got the 2E width and they are perfect. I used to get a hotspot with the regular D width. People say that they're heavy- I don't agree. If you run on concrete, get these now.
title: A runner's shoe

text: Asics had been my go to until the last year when I switched to the Brooks Pure Project and I really like the way they feel and fit.  The one drawback on my current pair of Pure Connect is the beating my feet take on long runs.  I decided to go back to Asics and Nimbus has been a good choice so far.  Ran a dozen last weekend without any of the standard aches and with 30 miles in these have been a quality change up from the lighter Brooks shoe.  The last pair of Asics I ran in were from the Cumulus line and the Nimbus seems to be a little bulkier at this point, but that simply could be the transition from the Brooks.
title: Solid long run trainer

text: Nominal shoe size: 14D. Ordered 14EE.After reading multiple reviews about these shoes being too narrow, I decided to try the EE width. In this endeavor, I learned that running shoe widths increment by double letters only---a boot width of E is equivalent to a running shoe width of EE for some reason.Even with the wider shoe, I can still feel it rubbing my two smallest toes, so I caution you that these shoes do run narrow. Nonetheless, this mild rubbing is not painful and is getting better as the shoe break in. Overall, I am very happy (4.5 stars). Their comfortable sole and light wight have made my running more enjoyable than ever. I'm glad I decided to try ASICS.
title: Buy the wider ones and you'll be happy

text: Very comfortable running shoes, with good quality.  I have wide feet, so I normally wear a 10.5 wide or an 11 regular width.  One of the reasons I ordered these is because I was surprised to see that I could get running shoes in a wide size online.  I will say that I was kind of surprised that the 10.5 wide seems to be the exact size of my foot, just touching on the edges all the way around.  I haven't really decided if I think that's too small, I guess I'm just not used to shoes that don't have extra room.
title: Very comfortable running shoes

text: First pair of ASICS I have owned, and I am proud that I do. I am not a small man, at 260+ right now. These shoes are light and airy, easy to forget you are wearing them. The cushioning is like an air-ride suspension, you feel no impact or shock.I plan on purchasing more of these in the future. A little side note. I can wear either a size 11 or a size 11 1/2 in these; the 11 would have been my choice were I actually running a lot, as they fit and grip. Instead, I chose the 11 1/2, to give my feet a little extra room to be comfortable, as I use them primarily for my everyday knock around shoes. Very comfortable. If you are considering these even just a little, stop stressing and order them! You will Thank yourself later!
title: First ever pair of ASICS, but not my last!

text: Quality shoe with ample cushioning.  Holds up well.  I run about 20 miles per week and these will last me 3 - 4 months.  Can stretch the wear a bit more by replacing insoles.
title: Quality shoe with ample cushioning. Holds up well. ...

text: This is only my 2nd pair of Asics.  I am normally a Nike guy, but my first pair were a great deal.I have started walking/jogging and the old shoes (2+ yrs old) just weren't cutting it anymore.The first adventure out, I did 4 mikes with more aching.Next day, I did 5 miles in the morning and 3 miles in the evening.  Feet felt great and shin splints we're going away.Been using them for about a week now, and perfectly broken in.  Wore them to a baseball game last night entertaining clients (on my feet for 5 hrs) and no issue.Highly recommend them and I will be buying another pair sooner than later with my dramatic increase in activity.
title: Perfect for road walker/jogger

text: These shoes are wonderful !!  i have never owned a pair of Asics, and I am kicking myself for wearing New Balance shoes for so many years !  These shoes have extra gel in the insole, as compared to the Gel Cumulus 16.  The tongue is a tad longer which I like.  I use custom orthotics in my shoes and they fit perfectly in both shoes.  I noticed a difference as soon as I had them on my feet. The mesh upper provides excellent circulation to help keep the feet cool.  I am a convert and will keep buying Asics from now on !  If you are considering the Cumulus, buy this one instead because you get so much more for an extra $10.00. Order 1/2 size larger than your normal shoe size.
title: Like walking on clouds !!

text: I was looking for shoes that I could wear around town, at work in a casual environment, and out for everyday use. I've been a Nike guy for a very long time but wanted to give these a try. They have a ton of support and feel great on my feet, even after a long day. I don't run very much but do a lot of walking and these hold up very well. I really like the gel inserts that come with the shoes. I put them on and they felt natural, almost like I had been running around in them for a few weeks.If you are on the fence about getting some shoes for everyday use and are looking at this, go ahead and get them. I certainly am glad I did.
title: Great ride for everyday use.

text: In my first couple of runs, I felt a significant difference in the 16 over the 15! It feels like there's more structural support yet more cushiony than the 15. Right after getting the 15's, I developed pain in the back part of my upper leg under my butt - which acts like a sciatic nerve pinch. Not sure if it is that, but the 16's seem to be far more comforting to my issue.Also, the last 2 pairs of 15's completely deteriorated behind my Achilles heel area. Stuffing starting coming out towards the end of the shoe life, but never really felt like it affected the shoe's core performance.I love the 16's so far!!
title: Improvement over the 15!

text: Very much am a fan of this shoe.I had an ACL/Meniscus procedure on one of my knees and these sneakers feel very comfortable. Use them for long jogs or just casual walking. The soles were far more comfortable than expected. Anytime I have to go out I wear these, don't even care if they always match or not.I read a complaint of the shoes causing a blister. This happened to me ONCE because I wore loose fitting/baggy socks. Wear socks that fit snug and won't slide. Any blisters are because of the sock not because of the sneaker.
title: Pleasantly surprised

text: I either buy these or the Gel-Cumulus. Nimbus seem like they have a tiny better fit, but they cost more too. My size is 11 1/2 medium width. I weigh 160 and run about 25 miles/week on concrete bike paths. I like the cushion especially followed by the durability. (They figured out how to make the heels from material that lasts longer.) I've got several "retired" pair in my closet that I still wear for casual times. In the past, I've purchased New Balance and Saucony shoes of comparable quality when they were on sale and they were ok. I always have come back to Asics though.
title: really good running shoe

text: The Asics Gel-Nimbus series of running shoes are absolutely the best I've ever worn. I have arthritis in my knees and play table tennis 4-8 hours per day; without these, maybe 2 hrs. is all I can take. The all-around support and cushioning is superb and a godsend for me. Prior to taking up table tennis seriously, I played volleyball for 12 years and was already familiar with the Asics brand, but thought I could get away with a cheaper shoe for table tennis; you basically get what you pay for and this is worth its weight in gold. By the way, this is my 4th pair in recent weeks; yes, I'm impressed with the quality.
title: ... Asics Gel-Nimbus series of running shoes are absolutely the best I've ever worn

text: This is the 3rd pair of ASICS Gel-Nimbus I have owned in the last 3 years.  I just buy the new model each year.  They arrived very quickly and fit just as I expected.  Ran 2miles the day after I got them and then ran a 10K the day after that.  No problems with the shoes at all.  I am not a "small" frame person.  I am 47 year old male that is 6' and 245lbs.  These shoes work very well for me and give all the support and comfort I need.  Several of my "large frame" friends joke and call them "fat boy running shoes"...its funny because its true.  Love these shoes!!!
title: Fat Boy Running Shoes :-)

text: I purchased these shoes after researching the best foot wear to help my plantar fasciitis condition. At the price I paid from Amazon, these were 70 dollars less than my local sporting good store.These shoes literally made my heel pain go down by half the first day of wearing them. By day five, I have very little pain at all. I could not be happier than I am with these shoes. I will never buy crappy shoes again. Asics from now on for me!They are well made, extremely supportive, and lightweight. Give these shoes a shot if you have foot pain.
title: If you have plantar fasciitis, read this review!

text: I have been wearing the Nimbus series as my primary running shoes since the 12s. And while the 13s were hands down the most comfortable shoe ever, the 16s do a good job ranking in towards the top of their series. I run shorter distances 4-6 miles a day, and these shoes are perfect for that. I do a mix of road and trail (single track) runs and the traction has never been an issue. The weight is a bit high, but I only train in these. I do races in other shoes. Reviews are tricky with running shoes though, I guess you can take away these shoes are not 'terrible' ...for me.
title: Another good year for the Nimbus

text: I love these shoes, but hate the color choices as many others have also said. Suggest trying on some Asics at a store just to get the fit correct before ordering.  I tried on several GT 1000 and 2000 styles in different lengths and widths until I got it right and wound up ordering a 10.5 4E.  I normally wear a 9 W in my casual and dress shoes if that tells anything about variance among shoe styles and manufacturers. The third day my feet started to hurt and I didn't think it was the shoes just old age.  I got home and it hit me that maybe my feet would have held up better if i'd bought a more expensive shoe with a better cushioned sole.  Amazon sent me an email about men's shoes and the Asics Gel-Nimbus 16's were on sale and the listing talked about the Gel impregnated sole.  I thought i'd give them a try to see if I thought they would make my feet hold up better on extended walks like i'd gone on in Orlando.  I ordered a pair and I tried them on the first time yesterday.  I ordered these in the 2E size instead of the previous 4E and when I first put them on they felt a little snug, but they were brand new.  I had quite a bit of walking to do that day and just in case I took my spare pair of Asics Gel-Flux shoes that were well broken in along just in case my new Gen-Nimbus 16's hurt my feet.  What a pleasant surprise I had with the Asics Gel-Nimbus 16 shoes.  The more I walked in them the better they felt and I did a good bit of walking the first day in a brand new pair of shoes.  I usually switch the liner in my shoes to a gel liner and take out the original liner, but I didn't have a new liner to put in my new shoes so I thought i'd give them a try just as they came out of the box.  The Asics Gel-Nimbus 16's have a  Gel impregnated sole and I was amazed at how well they felt brand new not broken in.  I had to go back to the hospital today to see a family member and there was quite a bit of walking involved like the first day since you had to park quite a ways from the hospital and I wore my new Asics today which was day two  for my Gel-Nimbus 16's and they felt even better since they were softening up and breaking in and I was just amazed at how well they felt.  In fact I was so amazed and excited about these shoes that I ordered another pair from Amazon just like them so I can rotate them.  I have quite a few pairs of athletic shoes and most of them will be getting some closet time now after I discovered the Asics Gel-Nimbus 16's shoes.  I'd recommend these shoes to my friends based on my experiences of owning many different styles of athletic shoes in my life and this model Asics shoe is a very good comfortable shoe!

text: On to my 4th pair of Nimbus, and as usual a great fit.  I knew my size and my usual 2E width and Asics makes them so consistently that I didn't have to try out a pair at an outlet before buying.  Also feel these are slightly lighter than my previous pair (Nimbus 13).  I use these for my weekly runs usually 6 - 10km and a couple of events a year and they are good for regular training and events.... I don't race enough to justify a separate pair of racers.  My feet has more tendency to roll outwards than inwards and these are definitely more suitable if you are a neutral to slight underpronator.  I would recommend 2E width if you see that your feet are bulging out of your current shoes at the sides (esp just behind the little toe)... the 2E widths are slightly wider and make a very comfortable fit. text: I should start this review with saying I'm not much of a runner; I'm just a 200 lbs. guy with bad feet who works out 5 days a week.  I might run a few laps or do some jump training, but for the most part I wear these shoes for weightlifting and cardio on machines, not treadmills.  I gave up serious running after getting plantar fasciitis a number of years ago.  That's when I switched from New Balance to Asics, specifically the Kayano, to get a shoe with more support.  I had about every version of Kayano from the 12's to the 19's, sometimes two of the same version.  I loved that line, until the 19's and what I saw of the 20's.  It seemed like they took a supportive cushion training shoe perfect for a heavier guy who ran occasionally to stay in shape , and took out all of the cushion and some of the support to make it a lighter race shoe for a 150 lbs. marathon guy.  I switched to the Nimbus line at the 15's and LOVED those shoes.  I was worried when I got these 16's that Asics was doing the same thing with the Nimbus line.  They seemed to have less padding around the tongue and collar, and the sole seemed stiff.  But after a few days to break them, they've been just as comfortable as the previous pair.  They're not as supportive as the Kayanos were, they seem to let your foot go where it wants when running, but the cushion is better.  My feet don't hurt after workouts.  I haven't run much in them, but jump training has felt great and I might start running more with all this cushion underneath.

text: Although I liked the Asics Nimbus 15 alright, I was never totally pleased - a 4 star. In my mind, this is by far the best of the Nimbus' so far.The Nimbus 16 is a significant improvement in my opinion. I found the 16 to be a little sloppy and loose.  These fit true to a size 12.Support:  The support is where I find the 16 far superior to its predecessor.  Their is better ankle support and these shoes do not have any side roll - they provide excellent side support.  Also, I find the arch support far better and is perfect for my foot - I need some additional arch support.  The heel is very well cushioned and gives you a bit of a bounce when it strikes the pavement.  Also, the support for the ball of the foot is very good.  I do wear custom orthotics which are a huge benefit, but I also wore them with the old shoe.Weight:  I'm always a bit suspicious when I read a running shoe is even lighter than its predecessor.  I've found at times you give up support.  However, with the 16, I can't find any tradeoffs yet.  They feel practically weightless.Overall, this is a very comfortable running shoe that provides excellent all around foot support.  I am going to buy another pair if I can still find one so I will have a pair for future.  I like them that much.My only complaint is the pathetic insoles, but since all shoes suffer this problem, I didn't feel it fair to downgrade the rating.
